greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 2*sin(Pi/96).
comment: This constant appears in a historic problem posed by Adriaan van Roomen (Adrianus Romanus) in his Ideae mathematicae from 1593, solved by Viète. See the Havil reference, problem 1 (with a correction), pp. 69-74.
For details see the comments under A302711, also for the original reference.
reference: Julian Havil, The Irrationals, A Story of the Numbers You Can't Count On, Princeton University Press, Princeton and Oxford, 2012, pp. 69-74.
formula: The constant is 2*sin(Pi/96) = sqrt(2 - sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 + sqrt(2 + sqrt(3))))).
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Apr 28 2018
